leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 计算科学方法论与数值计算生态
leaf_cluster.typical_objects: 稀疏矩阵/算子, 网格与离散系统, PDE/ODE, 误差/收敛数据
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 离散化→求解→误差/稳定性→加速→验证→可复现
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 数值库/求解器框架 + 自动微分/可微分计算 + HPC

unit.unit_name: PDE 离散与通用求解框架（FDM/FEM/FVM）
unit.coverage_tools: 离散框架、装配、边界条件、网格/单元、弱形式工具链

queries: [WEB] open source finite element method library github
[WEB] high performance pde discretization tools github

tools.name: EDGE
tools.one_line_profile: Extreme-scale Discontinuous Galerkin Environment for seismic wave propagation
tools.detailed_description: EDGE is a high-performance Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) finite element software designed for extreme-scale seismic simulations. It focuses on solving partial differential equations (PDEs) related to wave propagation on unstructured meshes, leveraging modern hardware architectures for efficiency.

tools.name: GalerkinSparseGrids.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Sparse Grid Discretization with Discontinuous Galerkin Method for PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library implementing the Discontinuous Galerkin method on sparse grids for solving partial differential equations. It aims to mitigate the curse of dimensionality in high-dimensional PDE problems by using sparse grid discretizations.

tools.name: DLBFoam
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic load balancing library for OpenFOAM simulations
tools.detailed_description: DLBFoam is an open-source library that provides dynamic load balancing capabilities for fast-reacting flow simulations within the OpenFOAM framework. It optimizes parallel performance by redistributing computational load during runtime.

tools.name: flowtorch
tools.one_line_profile: Library for analysis and reduced-order modeling of fluid flows
tools.detailed_description: flowTorch is a Python library designed for the analysis and reduced-order modeling (ROM) of fluid flow data. It leverages PyTorch to provide tools for data-driven fluid dynamics, enabling efficient processing and modeling of complex flow fields.

tools.name: aether
tools.one_line_profile: Strongly-typed scientific computing framework for aerospace and physics
tools.detailed_description: Aether is an open-source, strongly-typed scientific computing framework written in Rust. It is designed for aerospace and physics simulations, providing a modern, type-safe environment for developing high-performance simulation tools.

tools.name: MOOSE (Neural)
tools.one_line_profile: Multiscale Object Oriented Simulation Environment for neural systems
tools.detailed_description: MOOSE is the core of a modern software platform for simulating neural systems, ranging from subcellular components and biochemical reactions to complex models of single neurons and large networks. It provides a Python scripting interface for defining and running simulations.

tools.name: BriefFiniteElement.Net
tools.one_line_profile: Linear-static Finite Element Method (FEM) analysis library for .NET
tools.detailed_description: BriefFiniteElement.Net is a C# library designed for performing linear-static Finite Element Method (FEM) analysis on solids and structures. It provides a framework for integrating FEM capabilities into .NET applications.

tools.name: calfem-matlab-iga
tools.one_line_profile: Isogeometric Analysis toolbox for CALFEM
tools.detailed_description: This toolbox extends CALFEM (Computer Aided Learning of the Finite Element Method) with Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) capabilities in MATLAB. It allows users to perform IGA simulations using the educational framework of CALFEM.

tools.name: Tsunamis.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Shallow Water Equations Solver in Julia
tools.detailed_description: Tsunamis.jl is a Julia-based solver for the Shallow Water Equations using the Finite Volume Method and HLLE Riemann Solver. It supports parallel execution, making it suitable for simulating tsunami propagation and other shallow water phenomena.

tools.name: exponax
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient Differentiable n-d PDE solvers in JAX
tools.detailed_description: exponax provides efficient, differentiable solvers for n-dimensional partial differential equations using JAX. It enables gradient-based optimization and machine learning integration with PDE simulations.

tools.name: sdfibm
tools.one_line_profile: Immersed boundary method with signed distance fields in OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: sdfibm implements an immersed boundary method (IBM) empowered by signed distance fields (SDF) within the OpenFOAM framework. It facilitates the simulation of flows around complex geometries without requiring body-fitted meshes.

tools.name: OpenCFDinCUDA
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated 2D Finite Volume Method fluid solver
tools.detailed_description: OpenCFDinCUDA is a 2D fluid simulation code implementing the Finite Volume Method (FVM) on structured meshes. It utilizes CUDA to accelerate computations on GPUs, providing a high-performance solver for fluid dynamics problems.

tools.name: larnd-sim
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation framework for pixelated Liquid Argon TPCs (DUNE)
tools.detailed_description: larnd-sim is the simulation framework for pixelated Liquid Argon Time Projection Chambers (LArTPCs), developed for the DUNE experiment. It simulates the detector response, including charge deposition, drift, and signal induction on pixelated readouts.

tools.name: Navier-Stokes-Projection-FVM
tools.one_line_profile: 2D Navier-Stokes solver using projection method and FVM
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran implementation of a 2D Navier-Stokes solver using the projection method and Finite Volume Method (FVM). It is designed for solving flow problems such as the lid-driven cavity and includes vorticity computation.

tools.name: Dedalus
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible framework for solving PDEs with spectral methods
tools.detailed_description: Dedalus is a flexible, open-source framework for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) using modern spectral methods. It supports a wide range of equations and domains, automatically handling parallelization and spectral discretization.

tools.name: pde-dataset-generator
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for generating PDE ground truth datasets from ARCSim, FEniCS and SU2
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to generate ground truth datasets for Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) by interfacing with established solvers like ARCSim, FEniCS, and SU2. It facilitates the creation of training data for machine learning models in scientific computing.

tools.name: fenics-DRL
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Reinforcement Learning framework for fluid mechanics using FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: A repository implementing Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) in a fluid mechanics setup, utilizing the FEniCS finite element framework for the underlying physics simulation.

tools.name: HELYX-OS
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source GUI for OpenFOAM CFD solver
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface for OpenFOAM, designed to facilitate the setup and execution of Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations.

tools.name: MOOSE (Medical)
tools.one_line_profile: Data-centric AI solution for multi-organ segmentation in PET/CT images
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline based on nn-UNet for generating multilabel organ segmentations to facilitate systemic whole-person research, capable of segmenting 120 unique tissue classes from whole-body PET/CT images.

tools.name: pinn-pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning library for solving differential equations using PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) on top of PyTorch for solving differential equations.

tools.name: Poisson_FDM_Multigrid
tools.one_line_profile: Poisson equation solver using Finite Difference Method and Multigrid
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of a solver for the Poisson equation utilizing the finite difference method (FDM) and multigrid acceleration techniques.

tools.name: EHL Solver
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB solver for Elastohydrodynamic Lubrication problems
tools.detailed_description: A solver for Elastohydrodynamic Lubrication (EHL) problems based on Finite Volume discretization of the Reynolds equation, incorporating cavitation and elastic deformation via Boundary Element Method.

tools.name: BoSSS
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin discretization framework
tools.detailed_description: A flexible framework for the development, evaluation, and application of numerical discretization schemes based on the Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) method.

tools.name: FEMlium
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization of finite element simulations on geographic maps
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for interactive visualization of finite element simulations on geographic maps using Folium.

tools.name: fenicsx-shells
tools.one_line_profile: FEniCS-based library for simulating thin structures
tools.detailed_description: A library built on the FEniCS Project for simulating thin structural elements like shells, useful in structural mechanics.

tools.name: DOLFINx
tools.one_line_profile: Next generation FEniCS problem solving environment
tools.detailed_description: The computational backend of the FEniCSx project, providing a high-performance C++ and Python interface for solving partial differential equations using the finite element method.

tools.name: FFCx
tools.one_line_profile: FEniCS Form Compiler for finite element forms
tools.detailed_description: The form compiler for the FEniCSx project, responsible for generating efficient C code from high-level mathematical descriptions of finite element variational forms.

tools.name: FIAT
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Automatic Tabulator
tools.detailed_description: A library for the automatic tabulation of finite element basis functions, used within the FEniCS and Firedrake projects.

tools.name: ER Framework
tools.one_line_profile: Nuclear physics experiment simulation and analysis framework
tools.detailed_description: A FairRoot-based framework dedicated to the simulation, reconstruction, data acquisition, and analysis of nuclear physics experiments at FLNR-JINR.

tools.name: FairRoot
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation and analysis framework for particle physics
tools.detailed_description: A C++ object-oriented framework for simulation, reconstruction, and data analysis in particle and nuclear physics experiments.

tools.name: FASP
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient solvers and preconditioners for discrete PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A package for developing and testing efficient solvers and preconditioners (Krylov, AMG, incomplete factorization) for discrete partial differential equations.

tools.name: ForestClaw
tools.one_line_profile: Quadtree/octree adaptive PDE solver
tools.detailed_description: A parallel, adaptive multi-block solver for partial differential equations on hierarchically refined grids, based on the p4est library.

tools.name: hybridPorousInterFoam
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM solver for hybrid-scale porous media flows
tools.detailed_description: An OpenFOAM solver designed for performing single- and two-phase flow simulations on hybrid-scale porous media.

tools.name: DL_Framework-for-PBS-Cloth-Simulation
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-embedded deep learning for cloth simulation
tools.detailed_description: A framework combining deep learning with physics-based simulation (PBS) for modeling cloth dynamics.

tools.name: GENIE Generator
tools.one_line_profile: Neutrino interaction simulation tool
tools.detailed_description: A universal neutrino event generator and simulation tool for neutrino experiments, supporting a wide range of energies and targets.

tools.name: CalculiX
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Method solver for field problems
tools.detailed_description: An open-source finite element analysis package capable of solving linear and non-linear structural mechanics and field problems.

tools.name: simwave
tools.one_line_profile: Acoustic wave propagation simulator
tools.detailed_description: A tool for simulating the propagation of acoustic waves using the finite difference method in 2D and 3D domains.

tools.name: NTUSTCFDLAB
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Finite Volume Method CFD solver
tools.detailed_description: A 3D Computational Fluid Dynamics solver based on the Finite Volume Method, implemented with hybrid OpenMP/MPI parallelism.

tools.name: OpenSTAP
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Method solver for structural analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Finite Element Method (FEM) solver based on the classic STAP code, updated with modern Fortran and additional element types for structural analysis.

tools.name: Assistive Gym
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-based simulation for human-robot interaction
tools.detailed_description: A physics-based simulation framework designed for modeling and training physical human-robot interaction and robotic assistance tasks.

tools.name: ITHACA-FV
tools.one_line_profile: Reduced Order Modelling for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing Reduced Order Modelling (ROM) techniques specifically for OpenFOAM to accelerate CFD simulations.

tools.name: quail
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight Discontinuous Galerkin solver
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight code based on the Discontinuous Galerkin method, designed for teaching and prototyping numerical discretization schemes.

tools.name: fenris
tools.one_line_profile: Finite element computation library in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing advanced finite element computations, written in the Rust programming language.

tools.name: jax-fenics
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable interface to FEniCS for JAX
tools.detailed_description: A library providing a differentiable interface connecting FEniCS finite element models with the JAX machine learning framework.

tools.name: jax-fenics-adjoint
tools.one_line_profile: JAX interface for FEniCS/Firedrake using adjoints
tools.detailed_description: A library enabling differentiation of FEniCS and Firedrake models within JAX using dolfin-adjoint/pyadjoint for gradient computation.

tools.name: JAX-DIPS
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable interfacial PDE solver
tools.detailed_description: A JAX-based differentiable solver for partial differential equations involving interfaces.

tools.name: OpenIFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Immersed Finite Element Method implementation based on deal.II
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Immersed Finite Element Method (IFEM) built upon the deal.II library, designed for solving partial differential equations with complex interfaces.

tools.name: dgtd
tools.one_line_profile: Maxwell's curl equations solver using discontinuous Galerkin methods
tools.detailed_description: A solver for Maxwell's curl equations utilizing discontinuous Galerkin time-domain (DGTD) methods, suitable for computational electromagnetics simulations.

tools.name: OpenSWPC
tools.one_line_profile: Seismic Wave Propagation Code by Parallel Finite Difference Method
tools.detailed_description: A parallel finite difference method (FDM) code designed for simulating seismic wave propagation in 3D and 2D viscoelastic media.

tools.name: MISO
tools.one_line_profile: Engineering design optimization tool based on MFEM
tools.detailed_description: A library built on top of MFEM to enable engineering design optimization (topology optimization, etc.) based on finite-element simulations.

tools.name: PLAID
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for representing and sharing physics simulation datasets
tools.detailed_description: PLAID (Physics-Learning AI Datamodel) is a flexible and extensible framework designed to standardize the representation and sharing of datasets derived from physics simulations for AI applications.

tools.name: PDLSM-FEM_mpi
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel coupled Peridynamics and FEM solver
tools.detailed_description: A parallel implementation of adaptively coupled peridynamics least squares minimization and finite element method (PDLSM-FEM) for 2D and 3D structure analysis.

tools.name: xpfem
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for finite element method in solid mechanics
tools.detailed_description: A Python package implementing the finite element method (FEM) specifically for solid mechanics problems.

tools.name: RBniCS
tools.one_line_profile: Reduced order modelling in FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of reduced order modelling (ROM) techniques (such as certified reduced basis method and POD-Galerkin) within the FEniCS finite element framework.

tools.name: redback
tools.one_line_profile: Rock mechanics with Dissipative feedBACKs (MOOSE module)
tools.detailed_description: A module for the MOOSE framework focused on simulating rock mechanics with dissipative feedbacks, enabling multi-physics simulations in geomechanics.

tools.name: SAP2Moose
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to extract SAP model data for Moose2Model visualization
tools.detailed_description: A project designed to extract model data from SAP systems using SOMIX to enable visualization within the Moose2Model environment, facilitating software analysis or system modeling.

tools.name: SIMO-Package
tools.one_line_profile: NURBS-based IsoGeometric Analysis (IGA) package
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB package implementing NURBS-based IsoGeometric Analysis (IGA) for educational and research purposes in computational mechanics.

tools.name: SPECFEM3D_GEOTECH
tools.one_line_profile: 3D slope stability analysis using spectral-element method
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software for 3D slope stability analysis and simulation of 3D multistage excavation based on the spectral-element method (SEM).

tools.name: SciBlend
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced Data Visualization Workflows within Blender
tools.detailed_description: A tool enabling advanced scientific data visualization workflows directly within Blender, allowing for high-quality rendering of scientific datasets.

tools.name: FractionalDiffEq.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Fractional Differential Equations solver for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for solving Fractional Differential Equations (FDEs) using high-performance numerical methods.

tools.name: BoundaryValueDiffEq.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Boundary value problem solvers for SciML
tools.detailed_description: A component of the SciML ecosystem providing solvers for boundary value problems (BVPs) in differential equations.

tools.name: DiffEqOperators.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Linear operators for discretizations of differential equations
tools.detailed_description: A library providing linear operators for the discretization of differential equations, facilitating the construction of finite difference and other numerical schemes within the SciML ecosystem.

tools.name: FEniCS.jl
tools.one_line_profile: SciML wrapper for the FEniCS Finite Element library
tools.detailed_description: A Julia wrapper for the FEniCS Finite Element library, enabling the use of FEniCS capabilities within the Julia scientific machine learning ecosystem.

tools.name: FiniteElementDiffEq.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Solvers for finite element discretizations of PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A package within the SciML ecosystem providing solvers specifically for finite element discretizations of partial differential equations.

tools.name: FiniteVolumeMethod.jl
tools.one_line_profile: 2D conservation equations solver using Finite Volume Method
tools.detailed_description: A Julia solver for two-dimensional conservation equations utilizing the finite volume method (FVM).

tools.name: FiniteVolumeMethod1D.jl
tools.one_line_profile: 1D Finite Volume Method implementation
tools.detailed_description: A Julia implementation of the finite volume method specifically for one-dimensional problems, part of the SciML ecosystem.

tools.name: HighDimPDE.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Deep BSDE and Feynman-Kac methods for high-dimensional PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for solving high-dimensional PDEs using Deep Backwards Stochastic Differential Equation (Deep BSDE) and Feynman-Kac methods, avoiding the curse of dimensionality.

tools.name: MethodOfLines.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Finite Difference PDE solving with Julia SciML
tools.detailed_description: A package for automatic finite difference discretization of PDEs using the Method of Lines (MOL), integrating with the Julia SciML ecosystem.

tools.name: NeuralPDE.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINN) Solvers
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for solving partial differential equations using Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) and other scientific machine learning techniques.

tools.name: PDEBase.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Common types and interface for ModelingToolkit PDESystems
tools.detailed_description: Provides the common types and interfaces for discretizers of PDESystems within ModelingToolkit, serving as infrastructure for the SciML PDE ecosystem.

tools.name: SedFoam
tools.one_line_profile: Sediment transport solver for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A two-phase flow solver for sediment transport applications implemented within the OpenFOAM toolbox.

tools.name: Sectrics
tools.one_line_profile: Truss Analysis Software Using The Finite Element Method
tools.detailed_description: Software for performing truss analysis using the finite element method (FEM), suitable for structural engineering applications.

tools.name: XFEM_Fracture2D
tools.one_line_profile: Matlab program for 2D fracture problems using XFEM
tools.detailed_description: A Matlab program for solving fracture problems involving arbitrary multiple crack propagations in a 2D linear-elastic solid using the Extended Finite Element Method (XFEM).

tools.name: SBFEM-UEL
tools.one_line_profile: ABAQUS polyhedral user element based on SBFEM
tools.detailed_description: Source code for an ABAQUS polyhedral user element (UEL) implementation based on the Scaled Boundary Finite Element Method (SBFEM).

tools.name: RapidCFD
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM fork running fully on CUDA platform
tools.detailed_description: A fork of OpenFOAM designed to run Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations entirely on NVIDIA GPUs using CUDA for acceleration.

tools.name: SlicerCBM
tools.one_line_profile: Computational Biophysics for Medicine in 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: An extension for 3D Slicer that provides tools for computational biophysics simulations and analysis in medical applications.

tools.name: SmartFlow
tools.one_line_profile: CFD-solver-agnostic deep reinforcement learning framework
tools.detailed_description: A deep reinforcement learning framework designed to be agnostic to the CFD solver, enabling AI-driven control and optimization of fluid dynamics simulations on HPC platforms.

tools.name: PyDEns
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for solving ODEs and PDEs via PINNs
tools.detailed_description: PyDEns is a Python framework that utilizes neural networks to solve Ordinary and Partial Differential Equations (ODEs & PDEs). It implements Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) capabilities, allowing for mesh-free solving of differential equations by embedding physical laws into the loss function of the network.

tools.name: Moltres
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation code for Molten Salt Reactors based on MOOSE
tools.detailed_description: Moltres is a simulation tool designed for Molten Salt Reactors (MSRs). It leverages the MOOSE framework to solve coupled physics problems relevant to nuclear engineering, specifically focusing on the thermal-hydraulics and neutronics of molten salt systems.

tools.name: PythonFOAM
tools.one_line_profile: In-situ data analysis and machine learning integration for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: PythonFOAM provides an interface to integrate Python-based data analysis and machine learning workflows directly with OpenFOAM simulations. It enables in-situ processing of CFD data, allowing for real-time analysis and control of fluid dynamics simulations.

tools.name: TensorFlowFoam
tools.one_line_profile: TensorFlow C-API integration for data-driven CFD in OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: TensorFlowFoam integrates the TensorFlow C-API into the OpenFOAM CFD solver. This tool allows researchers to develop and deploy data-driven algorithms, such as neural network-based turbulence models or flow control policies, directly within the OpenFOAM simulation environment.

tools.name: Apollo
tools.one_line_profile: MOOSE-based application for 3D electromagnetics simulation using MFEM
tools.detailed_description: Apollo is a scientific simulation application built on the MOOSE framework that integrates the MFEM library to solve 3D electromagnetic problems. It enables users to perform finite element analysis of electromagnetic fields within the scalable MOOSE ecosystem.

tools.name: torch-fenics
tools.one_line_profile: Interface bridging PyTorch and FEniCS for differentiable physics
tools.detailed_description: torch-fenics provides a seamless interface between the PyTorch machine learning framework and the FEniCS finite element solver. It enables differentiable physics simulations, allowing gradients to be backpropagated through FEniCS solves, which is essential for physics-informed learning and inverse problems.

tools.name: FBG-SimPlus
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Method simulation tool for Fiber Bragg Gratings
tools.detailed_description: FBG-SimPlus is a simulation tool designed for modeling Fiber Bragg Grating (FBG) sensors using the Finite Element Method (FEM). It simulates the reflection spectrums of FBG arrays in response to environmental factors like stress, strain, and temperature, aiding in sensor design and analysis.

tools.name: PhysRL
tools.one_line_profile: Reinforcement learning framework using Isaac Gym physics engine
tools.detailed_description: PhysRL is a high-performance framework for reinforcement learning research that leverages NVIDIA's Isaac Gym physics simulation engine. It is designed to facilitate the training of agents in physically realistic environments, suitable for robotics and control tasks.

tools.name: Isogeometric-BEM
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB implementation of Isogeometric Boundary Element Method
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains a MATLAB implementation for Isogeometric Boundary Element Analysis (IGA-BEM). It provides tools for solving boundary value problems using isogeometric concepts, integrating CAD geometries directly with analysis.

tools.name: pyiga
tools.one_line_profile: Python research toolbox for Isogeometric Analysis
tools.detailed_description: pyiga is a Python-based research toolbox designed for Isogeometric Analysis (IGA). It provides functionalities to perform numerical analysis using spline-based basis functions, bridging the gap between Computer-Aided Design (CAD) and Finite Element Analysis (FEA).

tools.name: IGAPack
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB package for Isogeometric Analysis with hierarchical refinements
tools.detailed_description: IGAPack is a MATLAB library for Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) that supports hierarchical refinements. It allows researchers to experiment with adaptive mesh refinement strategies within the IGA framework.

tools.name: isogeometric-analysis
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB code for Isogeometric Analysis and Finite Element Method
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains MATLAB implementations for both Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) and standard Finite Element Methods (FEM). It serves as a tool for numerical analysis, allowing for the study and comparison of these discretization techniques.

tools.name: Rodin
tools.one_line_profile: Modern C++20 framework for finite element method and shape optimization
tools.detailed_description: Rodin is a modern C++20 framework designed for Finite Element Method (FEM) analysis and shape optimization. It leverages modern C++ features to provide a flexible and efficient environment for solving PDEs and optimizing geometric shapes.

tools.name: FEMM
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Method Magnetics solver for 2D/axisymmetric problems
tools.detailed_description: FEMM (Finite Element Method Magnetics) is a suite of programs for solving low frequency electromagnetic problems on 2D planar and axisymmetric domains. It addresses magnetic, electrostatic, heat flow, and current flow problems, complete with graphical pre- and post-processors.

tools.name: cideMOD
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-based battery simulation framework using FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: cideMOD is a simulation tool for solving physicochemical equations related to batteries using the Finite Element Method via the FEniCS library. It supports various use cases including drive cycles, SEI growth, thermal modeling, and degradation studies for battery research.

tools.name: dflo
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin solver for compressible flows
tools.detailed_description: dflo is a C++ implementation of a Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) solver designed for simulating compressible fluid flows. It provides a high-order accurate method for solving conservation laws in fluid dynamics.

tools.name: Foam-Agent
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-agent framework for automating OpenFOAM CFD simulations
tools.detailed_description: An end-to-end, composable multi-agent framework designed to automate Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations within OpenFOAM. It leverages LLM-based agents to handle case setup, execution, and error handling, facilitating autonomous scientific workflows.

tools.name: PetIGA
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) framework based on PETSc
tools.detailed_description: A framework for Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) that extends PETSc. It provides mechanisms to solve Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) using NURBS-based discretizations, leveraging PETSc's parallel linear algebra and solvers.

tools.name: igakit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for NURBS geometry generation in Isogeometric Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package focused on generating, manipulating, and refining NURBS (Non-Uniform Rational B-Splines) geometries (surfaces and volumes) specifically for Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) workflows.

tools.name: classy_blocks
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for procedural generation of OpenFOAM blockMesh dictionaries
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to simplify and automate the creation of complex `blockMeshDict` files for OpenFOAM. It provides a high-level object-oriented interface to define geometry and blocking strategies programmatically.

tools.name: XFEM_Fracture2D
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB implementation of Extended Finite Element Method for fracture modeling
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB code implementing the Extended Finite Element Method (XFEM) for modeling 2D linear-elastic fracture mechanics. It handles crack propagation and enrichment functions for discontinuity modeling.

tools.name: ultraSEM
tools.one_line_profile: Ultraspherical Spectral Element Method solver
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based solver implementing the ultraspherical spectral element method for solving partial differential equations with high accuracy. It combines the geometric flexibility of finite elements with the spectral accuracy of ultraspherical polynomials.

tools.name: evoxels
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics framework for voxel-based microstructure simulations
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics framework designed for simulating voxel-based microstructures. It enables gradient-based optimization of material properties and structures by providing differentiable simulation steps.

tools.name: tIGAr
tools.one_line_profile: Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) library for FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that enables Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) within the FEniCS framework. It allows users to perform simulations using spline-based geometries directly compatible with FEniCS's UFL (Unified Form Language).

tools.name: deal.II
tools.one_line_profile: C++ software library for finite element adaptive mesh simulations
tools.detailed_description: A massive C++ software library supporting the creation of finite element codes and an open community of users and developers. It provides state-of-the-art support for adaptive meshes, complex finite elements, and parallel computing.

tools.name: JAX-FEM
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Finite Element Method library based on JAX
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable Finite Element Method (FEM) library built on Google JAX. It supports automatic differentiation through the entire FEM computation graph, enabling gradient-based optimization for inverse problems and machine learning integration.

tools.name: fenics_topopt_foam
tools.one_line_profile: Topology optimization framework coupling OpenFOAM and FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: A framework for performing topology optimization in fluid flow problems by coupling the OpenFOAM CFD solver with the FEniCS finite element library (specifically dolfin-adjoint) for sensitivity analysis and optimization.

tools.name: usv_sim_lsa
tools.one_line_profile: Unmanned Surface Vehicle (USV) simulation environment for Gazebo
tools.detailed_description: A simulation package for Unmanned Surface Vehicles (USVs) running on the Gazebo simulator. It includes models for hydrodynamics, water currents, and wind effects, enabling realistic testing of USV control and autonomy algorithms.

tools.name: PhaseFieldGrainGrowthSimulations
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB codes for phase field simulation of grain growth
tools.detailed_description: A collection of MATLAB implementations for simulating grain growth microstructure evolution using the phase field method. It solves the governing equations using centered finite difference methods and is widely used as a reference or educational tool in materials science.

tools.name: PHiLiP
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel High-Order Library for PDEs using Discontinuous Galerkin methods
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) using hp-adaptive Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) methods. It supports high-order approximations and parallel execution for computational physics problems.

tools.name: NebulaSEM
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Volume and Discontinuous Galerkin solver for PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A computational fluid dynamics solver implementing both Finite Volume (FV) and high-order Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) methods. It is designed for solving conservation laws on unstructured grids.

tools.name: PhyGNNet
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-informed Graph Neural Network for solving spatiotemporal PDEs
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of PhyGNNet, a framework that combines Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) with physics-informed constraints to solve spatiotemporal Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) on irregular domains.

tools.name: prism
tools.one_line_profile: C++ CFD library based on the finite volume method
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations using the Finite Volume Method (FVM). It provides basic infrastructure for solving fluid flow equations on unstructured meshes.

tools.name: ExaDG
tools.one_line_profile: High-Order Discontinuous Galerkin solver for Exascale computing
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) solver designed for exascale computing architectures. It focuses on matrix-free implementations and efficient parallelization for solving large-scale PDE problems.

tools.name: Exasim
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin code generator for scalable simulations
tools.detailed_description: Exasim is a tool for generating Discontinuous Galerkin codes designed for extreme scalable simulations, focusing on high-performance computing environments.

tools.name: FDFD.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Difference Frequency Domain method for electromagnetics in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A pure Julia implementation of the finite difference frequency domain (FDFD) method, specifically designed for electromagnetic simulations.

tools.name: fdfdpy
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Difference Frequency Domain method for electromagnetics in Python
tools.detailed_description: A pure Python implementation of the finite difference frequency domain (FDFD) method for electromagnetic simulations.

tools.name: fdaPDE-core
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for PDE discretization and computational geometry
tools.detailed_description: A C++ header-only library providing tools for Partial Differential Equation discretization, computational geometry, nonlinear optimization, and linear algebra.

tools.name: FESTIM
tools.one_line_profile: Hydrogen/tritium transport and heat transfer modelling using FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: A tool for coupled hydrogen/tritium transport and heat transfer modelling, built on top of the FEniCS finite element framework.

tools.name: Firedrake
tools.one_line_profile: Automated system for solving PDEs using the finite element method
tools.detailed_description: Firedrake is an automated system for the portable solution of partial differential equations using the finite element method (FEM), emphasizing code generation and composability.

tools.name: fireshape
tools.one_line_profile: Shape optimisation toolbox for Firedrake
tools.detailed_description: A shape optimisation toolbox built on the Firedrake finite element library, enabling gradient-based shape optimization for PDE-constrained problems.

tools.name: FLEXI
tools.one_line_profile: High order discontinuous Galerkin framework for conservation laws
tools.detailed_description: A high order discontinuous Galerkin framework designed for solving hyperbolic-parabolic conservation laws, suitable for large-scale CFD simulations.

tools.name: GALÆXI
tools.one_line_profile: High order discontinuous Galerkin framework for compressible flows on GPUs
tools.detailed_description: A high order discontinuous Galerkin framework specifically optimized for simulating compressible flows on GPU systems.

tools.name: fluidfoam
tools.one_line_profile: Python tool for OpenFoam postprocessing
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to facilitate the post-processing and analysis of simulation data generated by OpenFOAM.

tools.name: rheoTool
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for GNF and viscoelastic fluid flows in OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox developed to simulate Generalized Newtonian Fluid (GNF) and viscoelastic fluid flows within the OpenFOAM framework.

tools.name: cad_to_dagmc
tools.one_line_profile: Convert CAD geometry to DAGMC h5m files
tools.detailed_description: A tool to convert CAD geometry (STP files or Cadquery assemblies) into DAGMC h5m format, facilitating geometry preparation for Monte Carlo simulations.

tools.name: phaseflow-fenics
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of convection-coupled melting and solidification
tools.detailed_description: A simulation tool based on FEniCS for modeling convection-coupled melting and solidification of phase-change materials.

tools.name: sapphire
tools.one_line_profile: Engine for constructing PDE-based simulations using Firedrake
tools.detailed_description: An engine designed to simplify the construction of PDE-based simulations on top of the Firedrake finite element library.

tools.name: AxiSEM
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel spectral-element method for 3D wave propagation
tools.detailed_description: A parallel spectral-element method solver for 3D wave propagation in spherical geometries with axisymmetric or spherically symmetric structures, used in geophysics.

tools.name: SEISMIC_CPML
tools.one_line_profile: Finite-difference wave equation solver with PML conditions
tools.detailed_description: A set of open-source programs to solve 2D/3D elastic, viscoelastic, or poroelastic wave equations using finite-difference methods with PML boundary conditions.

tools.name: foamlib
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for interacting with OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A modern Python package that provides an interface for interacting with OpenFOAM cases and utilities, facilitating automation and scripting.

tools.name: openfoam-app
tools.one_line_profile: Native OpenFOAM application for macOS
tools.detailed_description: A standalone application packaging of OpenFOAM for macOS, enabling native execution of OpenFOAM solvers and utilities on Mac systems.

tools.name: G+Smo
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for isogeometric analysis (IGA)
tools.detailed_description: G+Smo (Geometry plus Simulation modules) is a C++ library for isogeometric analysis, aiming to integrate Computer-aided Design (CAD) and Finite Element Analysis (FEA).

tools.name: dedaLES
tools.one_line_profile: Large Eddy Simulation with Dedalus
tools.detailed_description: A tool for performing Large Eddy Simulations (LES) utilizing the Dedalus spectral solver framework.

tools.name: gprMax
tools.one_line_profile: Electromagnetic wave propagation simulation using FDTD
tools.detailed_description: Open source software that simulates electromagnetic wave propagation using the Finite-Difference Time-Domain (FDTD) method, specifically for Ground Penetrating Radar (GPR) modelling.

tools.name: Gridap.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Grid-based approximation of partial differential equations in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Julia library for the grid-based approximation of partial differential equations (PDEs), providing a flexible framework for FEM and other discretization methods.

tools.name: GridapDistributed.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel distributed-memory version of Gridap
tools.detailed_description: An extension to Gridap.jl that enables parallel distributed-memory computations for solving PDEs.

tools.name: GridapEmbedded.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Embedded finite element methods in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Gridap extension providing tools for embedded finite element methods (CutFEM/AgFEM), allowing simulation on complex geometries using background meshes.

tools.name: GridapGmsh.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Gmsh mesh interface for Gridap
tools.detailed_description: A package enabling the use of Gmsh generated meshes within the Gridap ecosystem for PDE simulations.

tools.name: GridapMakie.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Makie plotting recipes for Gridap
tools.detailed_description: A visualization adapter that provides Makie plotting recipes for visualizing Gridap simulation results and meshes.

tools.name: GridapODEs.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Time stepping solvers for Gridap
tools.detailed_description: A package providing time-stepping algorithms and ODE solvers specifically designed to work with Gridap for transient PDE simulations.

tools.name: GridapPETSc.jl
tools.one_line_profile: PETSc solvers interface for Gridap
tools.detailed_description: A package that interfaces PETSc linear and nonlinear solvers with the Gridap finite element framework.

tools.name: GridapSolvers.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Solvers and preconditioners for Gridap
tools.detailed_description: A collection of solvers and preconditioners tailored for the Gridap ecosystem to enhance simulation performance.

tools.name: GridapFSI.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Fluid-structure interaction drivers for Gridap
tools.detailed_description: A Gridap-based package providing drivers and tools for simulating fluid-structure interaction (FSI) problems.

tools.name: GridapGeosciences.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Geoscience simulation drivers for Gridap
tools.detailed_description: A package built on Gridap containing drivers and models specifically for geoscience applications.

tools.name: GRINS
tools.one_line_profile: Multiphysics Finite Element package built on libMesh
tools.detailed_description: A multiphysics finite element package built on top of the libMesh library, designed for solving complex coupled physics problems using FEM.

tools.name: PENGoLINS
tools.one_line_profile: Coupling of non-matching isogeometric shells using FEniCS and tIGAr
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for coupling non-matching isogeometric shells, leveraging FEniCS and tIGAr libraries for isogeometric analysis.

tools.name: PyPDE
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for solving hyperbolic or parabolic PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A library for solving systems of hyperbolic or parabolic Partial Differential Equations, capable of handling stiff source terms and non-conservative components.

tools.name: taichi-fvm2d-fluid-ns
tools.one_line_profile: 2D FVM compressible fluid solver in Taichi
tools.detailed_description: A 2-Dimensional Finite-Volume-Method compressible fluid solver implemented in the Taichi programming language for high-performance simulation.

tools.name: MAPLEAF
tools.one_line_profile: 6-DOF Rocket Flight Simulation Framework
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive framework for 6-Degree-of-Freedom rocket flight simulation, supporting aerodynamic modeling and trajectory prediction.

tools.name: spherical-PDE-solver
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral method solver for PDEs on spherical surfaces
tools.detailed_description: A numerical program designed to solve Partial Differential Equations on a spherical surface using spectral methods with spherical harmonics.

tools.name: HORSES2D
tools.one_line_profile: 2D high-order spectral element method fluid dynamics solver
tools.detailed_description: A high-order spectral element method solver for two-dimensional fluid dynamics simulations.

tools.name: hyStrath
tools.one_line_profile: Hypersonic / Rarefied gas dynamics simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A simulation code for hypersonic and rarefied gas dynamics, developed for high-speed aerodynamic research.

tools.name: PINNacle
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark of Physics-Informed Neural Networks for Solving PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark suite for evaluating Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) on various PDE solving tasks.

tools.name: EMRALD
tools.one_line_profile: Event Modeling Risk Assessment using Linked Diagrams
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for dynamic Probabilistic Risk Assessment (PRA) that couples with physics-based simulations to model complex interactions and event sequences.

tools.name: BlackBear
tools.one_line_profile: MOOSE-based code for simulating degradation processes in materials
tools.detailed_description: A MOOSE-based application for simulating degradation processes in concrete and other structural materials.

tools.name: Mastodon
tools.one_line_profile: MOOSE app for structural dynamics and seismic analysis
tools.detailed_description: A MOOSE-based application designed for structural dynamics, seismic analysis, and risk assessment of structures.

tools.name: MOOSE
tools.one_line_profile: Multiphysics Object Oriented Simulation Environment
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance, open-source finite element framework for solving complex coupled multiphysics problems.

tools.name: igatools
tools.one_line_profile: Isogeometric analysis library
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for isogeometric analysis (IGA), providing tools for numerical simulation using spline-based basis functions.

tools.name: Isogeometric-Analysis
tools.one_line_profile: Matlab library for Isogeometric Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB library implementing Isogeometric Analysis methods for numerical solution of PDEs.

tools.name: hedge
tools.one_line_profile: Hybrid-and-Easy Discontinuous Galerkin Environment
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based environment for Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) methods, designed for solving PDEs.

tools.name: YASK
tools.one_line_profile: Domain-specific language and framework for high-performance stencil code
tools.detailed_description: Yet Another Stencil Kit (YASK) is a framework and DSL for creating high-performance stencil code, primarily for finite-difference methods.

tools.name: SAGE
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for measuring sim-to-real gaps in robot joint motions
tools.detailed_description: A framework for analyzing and measuring the simulation-to-reality gap in robotic joint motions, supporting physics simulation and statistical analysis.

tools.name: PhyCRNet
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-informed convolutional-recurrent neural networks for PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework implementing physics-informed convolutional-recurrent neural networks for solving spatiotemporal partial differential equations.

tools.name: PFC3D_OpenFOAM
tools.one_line_profile: Coupling interface for PFC3D and OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A tool for coupling PFC3D (Particle Flow Code) with OpenFOAM to enable fluid-particle interaction modeling.

tools.name: CfdOF
tools.one_line_profile: Computational Fluid Dynamics workbench for FreeCAD using OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A FreeCAD workbench that integrates OpenFOAM solvers, allowing users to perform CFD simulations directly within the FreeCAD environment.

tools.name: Puffin
tools.one_line_profile: Phase field and crystal plasticity simulation tool based on MOOSE
tools.detailed_description: Puffin is a simulation code based on the MOOSE framework that couples Phase Field methods with Crystal Plasticity. It is designed for modeling microstructure evolution and mechanical response in materials science.

tools.name: DiffusionPDE
tools.one_line_profile: Generative PDE solver using diffusion models
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of the 'DiffusionPDE' paper, providing a generative AI framework for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) under partial observation scenarios. It leverages diffusion models to infer full PDE solutions from sparse data.

tools.name: iga-matlab
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB library for Nonlinear Isogeometric Analysis (IGA)
tools.detailed_description: A collection of MATLAB functions and utilities for performing Nonlinear Isogeometric Analysis (IGA), a computational method that integrates finite element analysis (FEA) with computer-aided design (CAD) geometries.

tools.name: SEM2DPACK
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral Element Method solver for 2D wave propagation and fracture dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A spectral element method (SEM) software package designed for 2D wave propagation and fracture dynamics simulations, with a specific focus on computational seismology and earthquake source dynamics.

tools.name: semlab
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for Spectral Element Method wave propagation
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based implementation of the Spectral Element Method (SEM) for simulating wave propagation and rupture dynamics, serving as a research and educational tool for seismological modeling.

tools.name: nangs
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for solving PDEs with Physics-Informed Neural Networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework designed to facilitate the solution of Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) using Neural Networks (Physics-Informed Neural Networks - PINNs). It provides an interface to define PDE problems and train neural network solvers.

tools.name: CUDA-FDTD-simulation
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Finite Difference Time Domain (FDTD) solver
tools.detailed_description: A parallel implementation of the Finite Difference Time Domain (FDTD) method using CUDA for high-performance electromagnetic simulations on GPUs.

tools.name: plantFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Method simulator for plant and agricultural dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A simulation tool based on the Finite Element Method (FEM) specifically designed for agriculture. It models the multi-physical interactions of crops, canopies, and soil foundations for applications in farming, breeding, and agronomy.

tools.name: CompScienceMeshes.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Computational geometry and meshing library for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing computational geometry foundations and mesh handling capabilities specifically for Finite Element (FEM) and Boundary Element Methods (BEM).

tools.name: openInjMoldSim
tools.one_line_profile: Open source injection molding simulation solver for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: An OpenFOAM-based solver dedicated to the simulation of injection molding processes, allowing for the modeling of polymer flow and mold filling.

tools.name: SeismicMesh
tools.one_line_profile: 2D/3D mesh generation tool for seismological FEM
tools.detailed_description: A tool for generating 2D and 3D triangular/tetrahedral meshes, optimized for finite element methods in seismology and geophysics. It supports serial and parallel execution.

tools.name: butterfly
tools.one_line_profile: Python API for creating and running OpenFOAM cases
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that serves as a lightweight API for creating, configuring, and running OpenFOAM CFD simulations. It is often used to bridge OpenFOAM with other design tools like Grasshopper (via Ladybug Tools).

tools.name: crane
tools.one_line_profile: MOOSE application for plasma chemistry and reaction networks
tools.detailed_description: A MOOSE-based application designed for simulating general Chemical Reaction Networks (CRN), specifically targeting plasma chemistry and thermochemistry problems.

tools.name: NDG-FEM
tools.one_line_profile: Nodal Discontinuous Galerkin FEM solver for hydraulics
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based solver implementing Nodal Discontinuous Galerkin Finite Element Methods (NDG-FEM) for simulating various hydraulic and hydrodynamic problems.

tools.name: pyHype
tools.one_line_profile: Parallelized CFD framework for hyperbolic 2D Euler equations
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for developing parallelized Computational Fluid Dynamics software to solve the hyperbolic 2D Euler equations on distributed, multi-block structured grids.

tools.name: Deep-PPDE
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning solver for path-dependent PDEs
tools.detailed_description: Deep Learning methods to solve path-dependent PDEs and to price path-dependent derivatives like exotic options.

tools.name: multiphenics
tools.one_line_profile: Multiphysics prototyping library for FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: A library for easy prototyping of multiphysics problems in FEniCS, facilitating the definition of block systems for coupled PDEs.

tools.name: graph-pde
tools.one_line_profile: Graph neural networks for solving PDEs
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of graph neural networks and neural operators for solving partial differential equations, serving as a reference for AI4Science PDE solvers.

tools.name: baram
tools.one_line_profile: User-friendly CFD platform based on OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) software package designed to be accessible ('CFD for Everyone'), likely providing a GUI or simplified workflow around OpenFOAM solvers.

tools.name: delfem2
tools.one_line_profile: C++ framework for physics simulation and FEM
tools.detailed_description: Research prototyping framework for physics simulation written in C++, covering Finite Element Method (FEM) and other discretization techniques.

tools.name: maelstrom
tools.one_line_profile: Numerical simulation of magnetohydrodynamics (MHD)
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for the numerical simulation of magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) problems.

tools.name: ChiDG
tools.one_line_profile: Chimera-based Discontinuous Galerkin solver
tools.detailed_description: A Chimera-based (overset grid), discontinuous Galerkin solver for solving PDEs.

tools.name: openFuelCell2
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM-based CFD toolbox for fuel cells
tools.detailed_description: A computational fluid dynamics (CFD) toolbox for simulating electrochemical devices such as fuel cells and electrolysis, based on OpenFOAM.

tools.name: TR-FDTD
tools.one_line_profile: Time-Reversal FDTD Algorithm Implementation
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the Time-Reversal Algorithm using the Finite-Difference Time-Domain (FDTD) method for wave propagation problems.

tools.name: FEniCS4EM
tools.one_line_profile: Electromagnetic field solvers using FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: A collection of FEniCS codes and scripts for solving numerical electromagnetic field problems, serving as a domain-specific toolkit for EM simulation.

tools.name: philsol
tools.one_line_profile: FDFD mode solver for electromagnetic waveguides
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for calculating the modes of electromagnetic waveguides using the finite difference frequency domain (FDFD) method.

tools.name: porousMultiphaseFoam
tools.one_line_profile: Porous multiphase flow toolbox for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox for OpenFOAM designed to simulate multiphase flow in porous media.

tools.name: PIHM
tools.one_line_profile: Penn State Integrated Hydrologic Model
tools.detailed_description: A fully coupled multiprocess hydrologic model that uses semi-discrete finite volume approach to solve systems of ODEs representing hydrological processes.

tools.name: Variational-Doob
tools.one_line_profile: Lagrangian formulation of Doob's h-transform for rare event sampling
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Lagrangian formulation of Doob's h-transform, designed for efficient sampling of rare events in high-dimensional dynamical systems. It leverages variational methods to approximate the optimal control force required to bias the system towards the rare event of interest.

tools.name: GHOST
tools.one_line_profile: Geophysical High-Order Suite for Turbulence
tools.detailed_description: A highly scalable pseudospectral code designed to solve a variety of partial differential equations (PDEs) encountered in turbulent flow studies. It supports MPI and OpenMP parallelization and handles equations like incompressible Navier-Stokes, MHD, and Hall-MHD in periodic domains.

tools.name: DGM
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Galerkin Method for high-dimensional PDEs
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Deep Galerkin Method (DGM), a deep learning-based approach for solving high-dimensional partial differential equations. It uses neural networks to approximate the solution of PDEs by minimizing a loss function based on the PDE residuals and boundary conditions.

tools.name: DGFEM-Acoustic
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin FEM solver for acoustic wave propagation
tools.detailed_description: A C++ solver implementing the Discontinuous Galerkin Finite Element Method (DGFEM) specifically for simulating acoustic wave propagation. It focuses on high-order accuracy and flexibility in handling complex geometries for acoustic problems.

tools.name: precice-dealii-adapter
tools.one_line_profile: preCICE adapter for the deal.II finite element library
tools.detailed_description: An adapter allowing the deal.II finite element library to be coupled with other solvers via the preCICE coupling library. It enables partitioned multi-physics simulations where deal.II handles structural or fluid mechanics components.

tools.name: precice-fenics-adapter
tools.one_line_profile: preCICE adapter for the FEniCS computing platform
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based adapter connecting the FEniCS finite element framework to the preCICE coupling ecosystem. It facilitates the integration of FEniCS-based solvers into complex multi-physics workflows.

tools.name: precice-openfoam-adapter
tools.one_line_profile: preCICE adapter for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: An adapter enabling OpenFOAM to participate in partitioned multi-physics simulations managed by preCICE. It supports fluid-structure interaction (FSI), conjugate heat transfer (CHT), and other coupled physics scenarios using OpenFOAM solvers.

tools.name: preCICE
tools.one_line_profile: Coupling library for partitioned multi-physics simulations
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance coupling library for partitioned multi-physics simulations (e.g., fluid-structure interaction, conjugate heat transfer). It provides methods for data communication, mapping between non-matching meshes, and time interpolation between solvers.

tools.name: CFDTool
tools.one_line_profile: CFD simulation toolbox for MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations. It integrates with OpenFOAM and SU2 solvers, providing a GUI and scripting interface for setting up, running, and post-processing fluid flow and heat transfer simulations.

tools.name: FEATool Multiphysics
tools.one_line_profile: Fully integrated physics simulation platform for MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A multiphysics simulation toolbox for MATLAB that integrates FEA, FEniCS, OpenFOAM, and SU2. It offers a unified interface for modeling heat transfer, structural mechanics, fluid dynamics, and chemical engineering problems.

tools.name: Psydac
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for Isogeometric Analysis (IGA)
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) that facilitates the solution of PDEs using B-splines and NURBS. It provides tools for discretization, matrix assembly, and solving problems on complex geometries using IGA techniques.

tools.name: pyMOR
tools.one_line_profile: Model Order Reduction with Python
tools.detailed_description: A software library for building, analyzing, and solving reduced order models (ROMs) for parameterized partial differential equations. It supports various reduction methods (RB, POD, system-theoretic) and interfaces with external PDE solvers.

tools.name: pyro2
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for hydrodynamics explorations and prototyping
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework designed for teaching and prototyping hydrodynamics simulation codes. It implements various solvers for compressible and incompressible flow, diffusion, and advection, serving as a testbed for numerical methods.

tools.name: FreeCAD-Cfd
tools.one_line_profile: Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) workbench for FreeCAD
tools.detailed_description: A FreeCAD workbench that provides a GUI for setting up and running CFD simulations. It acts as a frontend for OpenFOAM and FEniCS solvers, allowing users to perform fluid analysis directly within the FreeCAD environment.

tools.name: FenicsSolver
tools.one_line_profile: Multiphysics FEM solver based on FEniCS library
tools.detailed_description: A multiphysics finite element solver built on top of the FEniCS library. It provides a structured way to define and solve coupled physics problems, including thermal, mechanical, and fluid systems.

tools.name: Symmer
tools.one_line_profile: Qubit subspace methods for quantum simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for implementing qubit subspace methods to reduce resource requirements for quantum simulations. It focuses on manipulating Pauli operator strings and symmetries to simplify Hamiltonians for near-term quantum devices.

tools.name: GeoPDEs
tools.one_line_profile: Isogeometric Analysis library for Octave and MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A software package for Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) implemented in Octave and MATLAB. It serves as a research and teaching tool for solving PDEs using B-splines and NURBS, supporting various problem types including elasticity and fluid flow.

tools.name: SummationByPartsOperators.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Summation-by-parts (SBP) operators for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing summation-by-parts (SBP) operators for finite difference, Fourier pseudospectral, and Galerkin methods. It ensures provably stable semidiscretizations for time-dependent PDEs, with a focus on correct boundary condition handling.

tools.name: IGAFrac
tools.one_line_profile: Isogeometric Analysis code for fracture simulation
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based code for simulating fracture mechanics using Isogeometric Analysis (IGA). It provides tools for modeling crack propagation and analyzing stress fields in materials using spline-based discretizations.

tools.name: section-properties
tools.one_line_profile: Finite element analysis of arbitrary cross-sections for structural engineering
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for the analysis of arbitrary cross-sections using the finite element method. It calculates cross-sectional properties (area, moments of inertia, torsion constants, etc.) and stress distributions, useful for structural engineering and mechanics.

tools.name: zombie
tools.one_line_profile: Grid-free Monte Carlo solver for partial differential equations
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library implementing the Walk-on-Spheres (WoS) algorithm and other grid-free Monte Carlo methods for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) such as Poisson and screening equations. It enables scalable geometric processing without mesh generation.

tools.name: florence
tools.one_line_profile: Pythonic finite element framework for multiphysics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive finite element framework for Python, supporting arbitrary order planar and curvilinear mesh generation. It provides solvers for linear and nonlinear analysis of coupled multiphysics problems, including solid mechanics and electro-mechanics.

tools.name: WoBToolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of the Walk-on-Boundary method for boundary value problems
tools.detailed_description: A CUDA/C++ implementation of the Walk-on-Boundary (WoB) method for solving boundary value problems, as presented in SIGGRAPH 2023. It provides a grid-free approach to solving PDEs by simulating random walks on the boundary of the domain.

tools.name: pointcloud-differential
tools.one_line_profile: Differential operators (gradient, divergence, Laplacian) on point clouds
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for computing differential operators (gradient, divergence, Laplacian) directly on point clouds. It is useful for solving PDEs on point clouds and learning anisotropic features in geometric deep learning applications.

tools.name: ProjectFEA
tools.one_line_profile: Extensible Finite Element Library for custom weak forms
tools.detailed_description: A C++ Finite Element Library designed for flexibility, allowing users to easily define and use new weak forms for different physical models. It aims to provide a modular framework for FEA research and development.

tools.name: DGTile
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin adaptive mesh library
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library from Sandia National Laboratories for portably performant discontinuous Galerkin (DG) adaptive mesh operations. It supports high-order discretization and adaptive mesh refinement for numerical simulations.

tools.name: sequential_PINN
tools.one_line_profile: PINN for coupled thermochemical physics in bi-material systems
tools.detailed_description: A Physics-Informed Neural Network (PINN) implementation for solving coupled partial differential equations governing thermochemical physics. It specifically targets bi-material systems and demonstrates the application of sequential PINN training strategies.

tools.name: cashocs
tools.one_line_profile: Adjoint-based shape optimization and optimal control software
tools.detailed_description: A Python software package for computational adjoint-based shape optimization and optimal control. It automates the derivation and solution of adjoint systems for PDE-constrained optimization problems, built on top of the FEniCS framework.

tools.name: SfePy
tools.one_line_profile: Simple Finite Elements in Python
tools.detailed_description: A software for solving systems of coupled partial differential equations (PDEs) by the finite element method in 1D, 2D and 3D. It can be used as a library or as a standalone solver for problems in solid mechanics, fluid dynamics, and other physics fields.

tools.name: Zapdos
tools.one_line_profile: MOOSE-based application for plasma simulation
tools.detailed_description: An open-source application built on the MOOSE framework for simulating plasma physics. It leverages MOOSE's finite element capabilities to solve the drift-diffusion and other plasma-related equations.

tools.name: pyOpenFOAM
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based Finite Volume Method CFD library
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing the Finite Volume Method (FVM) for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD). It is designed to simulate fluid flow and heat transfer, following the principles of OpenFOAM and standard FVM textbooks.

tools.name: SOFA
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time multi-physics simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: An open-source framework primarily for real-time medical simulation, supporting multi-physics simulation (mechanics, thermodynamics, electrophysiology). It uses various numerical methods including FEM and mass-spring systems for interactive simulations.

tools.name: MORFEUS
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-physics Object-oriented Reconfigurable Fluid Environment
tools.detailed_description: A simulation framework for multi-physics problems, focusing on fluid dynamics. It provides an object-oriented environment for unified simulations, likely supporting various discretization methods for fluid flow.

tools.name: shenfun
tools.one_line_profile: High performance spectral Galerkin method platform in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python platform for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) using the spectral Galerkin method. It automates the creation of matrices and vectors for spectral methods and supports high-performance computing via MPI.

tools.name: Spirit
tools.one_line_profile: Atomistic Spin Simulation Framework
tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform framework for atomistic spin simulations. It allows for the simulation of magnetic systems using various methods, including Landau-Lifshitz-Gilbert dynamics and Monte Carlo methods, with real-time visualization capabilities.

tools.name: dem-fem-coupling
tools.one_line_profile: Coupling of Finite Element Method and Discrete Element Method
tools.detailed_description: Open source codes for coupling Finite Element Method (FEM) and Discrete Element Method (DEM) simulations. It bridges the YADE (DEM) and OOFEM (FEM) software packages to enable multi-scale or multi-physics simulations involving granular materials and structures.

tools.name: HelFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Finite element methods for electronic structure calculations
tools.detailed_description: A software package implementing finite element methods for electronic structure calculations on small systems. It applies high-order finite elements to solve the Schrödinger equation for atoms and molecules.

tools.name: eom
tools.one_line_profile: Configurable ODE/PDE solver in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library providing explicit and semi-implicit numerical schemes for solving ordinary and partial differential equations, designed for high performance and configurability.

tools.name: Multiphysics
tools.one_line_profile: DG-FEM solver for hyperbolic systems (Shallow Water Equations)
tools.detailed_description: A Discontinuous Galerkin Finite Element Method (DG-FEM) solver using Runge-Kutta time stepping, specifically optimized for hyperbolic systems like shallow water equations.

tools.name: Neural-Solver-Library
tools.one_line_profile: Library for Advanced Neural PDE Solvers
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library implementing various neural network-based methods for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs), serving as a foundation for AI4Science research.

tools.name: GDS3D
tools.one_line_profile: 3D renderer for IC layout GDSII files
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool that interprets GDSII integrated circuit layout files and renders them in 3D, allowing for real-time inspection of semiconductor process structures.

tools.name: PhiFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable PDE solving framework for machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable simulation framework for fluid dynamics and other physical systems, designed to integrate seamlessly with machine learning frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, and JAX.

tools.name: turbinesFoam
tools.one_line_profile: Actuator line modeling extension for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A library extension for OpenFOAM that implements actuator line modeling, specifically designed for simulating wind and tidal turbines within CFD environments.

tools.name: jaxdf
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based framework for differentiable numerical simulators
tools.detailed_description: A research framework built on JAX for creating differentiable numerical simulators with arbitrary discretizations, facilitating gradient-based optimization in physical simulations.

tools.name: hybridCentralSolvers
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of hybrid central solvers for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A suite of solvers for OpenFOAM implementing hybrid central schemes for compressible flows, supporting one-phase, two-phase, and multicomponent systems.

tools.name: libAcoustics
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM library for far-field noise computation
tools.detailed_description: An OpenFOAM library dedicated to computing far-field noise from CFD simulations using acoustic analogies (e.g., Ffowcs Williams-Hawkings).

tools.name: FiPy
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Volume PDE solver in Python
tools.detailed_description: An object-oriented Partial Differential Equation (PDE) solver, written in Python, based on a standard finite volume (FV) approach. It is designed for solving coupled sets of PDEs.

tools.name: DRLinFluids
tools.one_line_profile: Platform coupling Deep Reinforcement Learning and OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform that integrates Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) algorithms with OpenFOAM for flow control and optimization problems in fluid dynamics.

tools.name: fealpy
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Analysis Library in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for finite element analysis, providing data structures and algorithms for mesh generation, assembly, and solving of PDEs using FEM.

tools.name: drdg3d
tools.one_line_profile: DG-FEM code for 3D dynamic rupture modeling
tools.detailed_description: A Discontinuous Galerkin Finite Element Method code specifically designed for simulating 3D dynamic rupture processes in seismology and geophysics.

tools.name: ofpp
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM Python Parser
tools.detailed_description: A Python library to parse OpenFOAM output files directly into Numpy arrays, facilitating data analysis and post-processing of CFD results in Python.

tools.name: wan
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning-based solver for high-dimensional PDEs using Weak Adversarial Networks
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Weak Adversarial Network (WAN) method for solving high-dimensional partial differential equations based on their weak formulation.

tools.name: DGseisfor3D
tools.one_line_profile: 3D seismic wave simulation solver based on the Discontinuous Galerkin Method
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran-based solver for 3D simulation of seismic waves utilizing the Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) method, suitable for geophysics and wave propagation studies.

tools.name: NonLinPDEs-GPsolver
tools.one_line_profile: Solver for nonlinear PDEs using Gaussian Processes
tools.detailed_description: Code implementation for solving and learning nonlinear partial differential equations using Gaussian Processes, enabling probabilistic inference for PDE parameters and solutions.

tools.name: Futureye_JIT
tools.one_line_profile: Java-based Finite Element Method (FEM) library for solving PDE forward and inverse problems
tools.detailed_description: A Java FEM library designed for efficiency comparable to Fortran, supporting the solution of PDE-based forward and inverse problems.

tools.name: Multiscale-FEM
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB implementation of the Multiscale Finite Element Method (MsFEM)
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB codebase implementing the Multiscale Finite Element Method, useful for solving PDEs with multiscale features in materials science and physics.

tools.name: dugksFoam
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFOAM solver for Boltzmann model equations using the Discrete Unified Gas Kinetic Scheme
tools.detailed_description: An OpenFOAM-based solver implementing the Discrete Unified Gas Kinetic Scheme (DUGKS) for simulating Boltzmann model equations, applicable to rarefied gas dynamics.

tools.name: GridapTopOpt.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Computational toolbox for level set-based topology optimization in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia toolbox built on the Gridap ecosystem for performing level set-based topology optimization, facilitating structural design and analysis.

tools.name: py-pde
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for solving partial differential equations using finite difference methods
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python package for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) on grids using finite difference methods, supporting various boundary conditions and differential operators.
